page.title: 13RIDING SCHOOL STEVENAGE
page.content: Courtlands Riding Stables is in Todd's Green. It began with three sisters and their ponies in 1969.Two years later their parents obtained planning permission to open a riding stables with nine ponies. Over the years since then the number of mounts has grown to 35 of which 20 are ponies and 15 are horses. As they became more experienced they were able to increase the range of activities to include exams,road safety work, one-day events gymkhanas and show jumping. Between 80 and 100 riders use the stables each week. This facility which many people in the area use may soon be closed to make way for a by-pass around the village of Little Wymondley. Hopes have been raised that an alternative route to the north of the village may be used instead.
